Uses of Class
edu.unm.health.biocomp.hscaf.ScaffoldTree

Uses of ScaffoldTree in edu.unm.health.biocomp.hscaf
 

Methods in edu.unm.health.biocomp.hscaf with parameters of type ScaffoldTree
static float hier_scaffolds_utils.commonScaffoldTanimoto(ScaffoldTree scaftreeA, ScaffoldTree scaftreeB)
          Returns similarity metric designed to reflect the significance of the maximum common scaffold between two molecules. Given by the formula:
  sim = nc / (na + nb - nc)
where
  nc = # atoms in common scaffold
  na = # atoms in max scaffold, mol A
  nb = # atoms in max scaffold, mol B
This is an experimental functionality. Intended for use in combination with a standard whole-molecule similarity metric.
static float hier_scaffolds_utils.commonScaffoldTanimoto(ScaffoldTree scaftreeA, ScaffoldTree scaftreeB, Scaffold mcScaf)
          Returns similarity metric designed to reflect the significance of the maximum common scaffold between two molecules. Given by the formula:
  sim = nc / (na + nb - nc)
where
  nc = # atoms in common scaffold
  na = # atoms in max scaffold, mol A
  nb = # atoms in max scaffold, mol B
This is an experimental functionality. Intended for use in combination with a standard whole-molecule similarity metric. Use this faster method if mcScaf is already calculated (with maxCommonScaffold()).
static Scaffold hier_scaffolds_utils.maxCommonScaffold(ScaffoldTree scaftreeA, ScaffoldTree scaftreeB)
          Finds maximum common scaffold in two ScaffoldTrees. If none returns null.
